text: Bottle... Pours clear and yellow with a short-lived white head. This cream ale (in a completely uncharacteristic fashion) is all about the hops - juicy melons, muskiness and white pepper. Medium-bodied with prickly carbonation. The flavor offers smooth cereal grains and a modest level of citrusy, musky, rindy bitterness. Finished dry and raspy. An oddity, this one, but tasty nonetheless. Bottle courtesy of ygtbsm94!

Very light yellow color, but copious head and lacing. Smells like a light IPA, hops, straw, not much else... Taste is hops, straw, grass... bitter with a creamy palate. Its not bad. A perfect craft beer for the summer.
A mineral floral hop aroma, pours a clear light gold color with a thin white well laced head. A refreshing taste of floral hops with a dry feel very refreshing with a floral hop finish.

Poured from a bottle. Clear golden color, small white head. Fruit hops aroma. Light body with a sweet grass hops flavor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[ bottle ][ 1.5oz ][ @Tasting ][ $? ][ schnapps snifter ][ 03.05.15 ]
muddy chocolate pour, murky with thin cream bubbled ring, tepid appearance. Sweet nose, sugary booze and gummy, heavy alcohol presence. Flavor similar, burning heat, medicinal across mid palate, growing late in cloying, bitter, lightly herbal finish. transparent gold, thin white ring, tepid appearance. Lotion-heavy nose, urinal cakes, heavy perfume aspects. Burning medicine at front, plant-heavy, bitter throughout. Thick and syrupy.

Clear golden coloured body with a slight orange and copper glow, all with a half centimetre tall rather funky looking tan head. Aroma of rich fresh hops, some subdued grassy and herbal elements and a touch of malt with alcohol. Medium-bodied; Assertive grassy and herbal hoppy flavour with a big kick of alcohol, bitterness and pungency on the finish especially with a touch of fruits, some light grain and a ton of grassy and malt elements noticeable. Aftertaste is deep and bitter from the hops, but more bitterness from the malt shows through. Overall, an interesting beer with a nice aroma, but the flavour and especially the palate leave just a bit too much bitterness and funky flavours from the malt and offensive side of things. I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased from Giant Food in Falls Church, Virginia on 04-March-2016 for US$1,75 sampled at home in Washington on 04-June-2016.

appearance: clear medium gold, creamy white head, decent lacing.  aroma: big, unique aromas; kind of grassy and peppery like a pils, but with some grapefruit, but also some dense, catty notes; under this is some popcorn and cracker.  taste: 	sharply hoppy at first (peppery), but then the danker hops come out with catty, herbal notes, then some pine, with a subtle but firm malt undertone of cracker and biscuit.  finish: the peppery, dank hops linger a bit, thinning out a creamy palate and keeping things lively.  notes: Creative take on the cream ale, which can be meh. Enjoyable. Bottle from the Beer & Wine Cellar in Rockville, Maryland.

Bottle from Bethesda Food and Beverage. Golden body with medium head. Nose is hoppy, peppery, spicy. Taste is hoppy with lots of layers of hops, rye and a fantastic, creamy texture. Well done beer, this one.

Closer to a session IPA than a cream ale, sporting heavy grapefruit and pine aromas. Hoppy throughout, but ends mildly with a soft lightly creamy fade. A good hot weather quencher that delivers lots of hop character sans agressive bitterness. Some nice cornbread notes in the background.
Pours clear golden with a small white head. Aroma is citrus, like orange peel, light vanilla. Taste is earthy , citrus, hoppy, pine, and finishes kind of peppery.
Draft. Large white head atop clear apple juice body. Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some corn. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some berry, spicy. Light-medium body, light acidity.
Bottle. Clear gold. Resiny hops, grapefuit, pine, slight sweet crackers. Flavor is the same. Medium slick body.

Extremely hoppy, with some cream ale qualities on the aroma but nothing but IPA in the flavor. Pours pale yellow with faint, thin foam. Creamy, mildly yeasty aroma with some hops. Those hops are all over the flavor. Bitter front and back. Pretty good.

Growler, split at the March DC Tasting. Poured a golden yellow color with a small white head. Aroma was light tropical fruit notes, light citrus. Light fruity notes. Light and creamy, malts. Citrus. More of an IPA than cream ale, but not bad at all.
Pale golden pour. Strong cannabis aroma, light coffee. Creamy finish. Pretty good stuff.

Really like a pale ale. Way more hops in this than the average cream ale warrants. Golden pour. Bitter finish. Tap at rustico. Earlier Rating: 2/24/2016 Total Score: 3.5Really like a pale ale. Way more hops in this than the average cream ale warrants. Golden pour. Bitter finish. Tap at rustico.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2016 clear gold color; aroma is citrus and floral hops with pineapple notes; creamy, earthy, slightly sweet malt with bitter, herbal, citrusy hops witlots of pineappple and tropical fruit notes

12 oz bottle poured into a tulip. Clear golden straw yellow with about a finger of off-white head. Aromas of tropical fruit, citrus, biscuit, fruity cereal. Tastes of citrus, malt, light floral and herbs, candied fruit. Medium body with a dry finish.

Aroma: resin, floral, citrus, 
Appearance: clear golden with a white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, sticky, soft carbonation, bitter finish, 

Tasty
Draft at Meridian Pint. Crystal clear golden yellow color, thin white head. Aroma of peppery citrus. Taste is peppery lemon, straw. The hoppiest cream ale Ive had.

Bottle. Translucent gold with a short white head. Aroma is very hoppy and floral with soft fruit notes. Taste is big floral hops, pine and hops resins with soft malt and fruit. Body is medium with a strong, bubbly carbonation and a lingering hop bitterness. Ends with more floral hops, pine, hop resins, fruit and soft malt.

Collab pack. Pours a clear yellow, good white head. Aroma of sweetish pale malt and grapefruit plus dank hops. Faint hint of rubber. Flavor is initially sweetish corny malt, followed by the hops that match the nose. As it warms, the hops go down and the malts come up. There is a hint of something vaguely DMS or rubber like floating up at times, but then disappearing. Not bad, but overall this one wasnt working for me. Needed to be just a touch cleaner I think.
Bottle from the Collaboration Pack. Pours a clear light golden color with white head. Citrus, corn, grainy aromas. Grain, earthy, slight citrus, herbal flavors.

12 ounce bottle poured into a snifter. The beer is a crystal clear gold color with a white head of foam that dissipates at a moderate rate. The beer has mild tropical fruit notes with a touch of doughy character coming through. Mostly a sweet beer, but there is some dry, floral and mildly piny bitterness as well. Higher carbonation and a lighter body. Pretty interesting beer. Better than the other imperial or double cream ales Ive had in the past.
Floral hop aromas, somewhat corny. Clear golden with a decently lasting white head. Dry, resinous, piney. Medium bodied, crisp.

Bottle from the Collaboration pack from Wine Warehouse.

Pours clear golden with a small white head. Aroma of citrus peel, light vanilla.

Taste is wet paper, earth, citrus, pine, and finishes peppery.

12 ounce bottle from the 2016 collaboration pack. Clear golden, large foamy white head, fair retention. Aroma of sweet corn, pale malt, floral hops. The taste is herbal, piney, dank hops, almost wet, sweet corn, pale malt. Medium bodied, lingering bitterness.
